title: Pence announces $16 million for Venezuelan migrants
text:
LIMA (Reuters) - U.S. Vice President Mike Pence announced in Peru on Friday that Washington was giving $16 million to help Venezuelans who have fled the countryâ€™s economic crisis, some of which would go to host communities in Colombia and Brazil.
U.S. Vice President Mike Pence arrives at the airport for upcoming Summit of the Americas in Lima, Peru April13, 2018. REUTERS/Guadalupe Pardo Pence was in Lima to attend the Summit of the Americas that gathers regional heads of state on Friday and Saturday. Trump canceled his scheduled visit to the summit to focus on the crisis in Syria.
Reporting by Roberta Rampton; Editing by Sandra Maler
